column4: hello. I was hopong someone could help me out with a package i removed...specifically nagios... and then helping to reinstall it..
I did an apt-get --purge remove on nagios-mysql
but when i try to reinstall i dont get the options..again...the setup options
funny thing is that when i say...reinstall nagios-text or nagios-mysql...i dont "see" the typical /etc/nagios files...does the dpkg-reconfigure nagios-text put them there??
did you remove those files manually?
unfortunately at first it did...then had to manually remove the syslo.. or whatever entries..then that fixed apt-get.. ( I know I know).... but now im looking to reinstall the bastage...:)
there is an option to apt that will get it to reinstall the /etc/ files....
know that that option is?? or will I have to man for it
try apt-get -o DPkg::Options::="--force-confmiss" --reinstall install the packagename
hrmm...that shoulda reinstalled the config files
wonder if nagios-common also needs to be removed and reinstalled along with things..
but give it the options i gave you previously
